meanings.definition: A principle or standard by which something is judged or decided
meanings.sent1: In our school, the criterions for good behavior include being respectful and responsible.
meanings.sent2: The company uses strict criterions to select the best candidates for the job.
meanings.sent3: The criterions for choosing the best ice cream flavor are quite challenging!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness became the criterions against which all other acts of generosity were measured.
meanings.sent5: The criterions for winning the race were clear: speed and endurance.

meanings.definition: A rule or test for judging or evaluating something
meanings.sent1: The criterions for passing the exam were clearly outlined by the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The criterions used in the experiment helped determine the outcome.
meanings.sent3: The criterions for finding the best pizza in town involved tasting every slice!
meanings.sent4: His dedication to practice became the criterions for success in the competition.
meanings.sent5: Following the criterions of good writing, she crafted a compelling story.
